account_email.description:
The account identifier. Can be reused in a different plugin instance. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

account_key.description: The private key associated with the account.

key_id.description:
The Key ID. 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

key_set.description:
The name of the key set to associate the Key ID with. 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

allow_any_domain.description: If set to `true`, the plugin allows all domains and ignores any values in the `domains` list.

api_uri.description: A string representing a URL, such as https://example.com/path/to/resource?q=search.

cert_type.description: The certificate type to create. The possible values are `rsa` for RSA certificate or `ecc` for EC certificate.

domains.description: An array of strings representing hosts. A valid host is a string containing one or more labels separated by periods, with at most one wildcard label ('*')

eab_hmac_key.description:
External account binding (EAB) base64-encoded URL string of the HMAC key. You usually don't need to set this unless it is explicitly required by the CA. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

eab_kid.description:
External account binding (EAB) key id. You usually don't need to set this unless it is explicitly required by the CA. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

enable_ipv4_common_name.description: A boolean value that controls whether to include the IPv4 address in the common name field of generated certificates.

fail_backoff_minutes.description:
Minutes to wait for each domain that fails to create a certificate. This applies to both a
new certificate and a renewal certificate.

preferred_chain.description: A string value that specifies the preferred certificate chain to use when generating certificates.

renew_threshold_days.description: Days remaining to renew the certificate before it expires.

rsa_key_size.description: RSA private key size for the certificate. The possible values are 2048, 3072, or 4096.

storage.description: The backend storage type to use. In DB-less mode and Konnect, `kong` storage is unavailable. In hybrid mode and Konnect, `shm` storage is unavailable. `shm` storage does not persist during Kong restarts and does not work for Kong running on different machines, so consider using one of `kong`, `redis`, `consul`, or `vault` in production.

host.description: A string representing a host name, such as example.com.

port.description: An integer representing a port number between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

token.description:
Consul ACL token. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

cloud_authentication.description: Cloud auth related configs for connecting to a Cloud Provider's Redis instance.

auth_provider.description:
Auth providers to be used to authenticate to a Cloud Provider's Redis instance. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

aws_access_key_id.description:
AWS Access Key ID to be used for authentication when `auth_provider` is set to `aws`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

aws_assume_role_arn.description:
The ARN of the IAM role to assume for generating ElastiCache IAM authentication tokens. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

aws_cache_name.description:
The name of the AWS Elasticache cluster when `auth_provider` is set to `aws`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

aws_is_serverless.description: This flag specifies whether the cluster is serverless when auth_provider is set to `aws`.

aws_region.description:
The region of the AWS ElastiCache cluster when `auth_provider` is set to `aws`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

aws_role_session_name.description:
The session name for the temporary credentials when assuming the IAM role. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

aws_secret_access_key.description:
AWS Secret Access Key to be used for authentication when `auth_provider` is set to `aws`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

azure_client_id.description:
Azure Client ID to be used for authentication when `auth_provider` is set to `azure`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

azure_client_secret.description:
Azure Client Secret to be used for authentication when `auth_provider` is set to `azure`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

azure_tenant_id.description:
Azure Tenant ID to be used for authentication when `auth_provider` is set to `azure`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

gcp_service_account_json.description:
GCP Service Account JSON to be used for authentication when `auth_provider` is set to `gcp`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

database.description: Database to use for the Redis connection when using the `redis` strategy

namespace.description: A namespace to prepend to all keys stored in Redis.

scan_count.description: The number of keys to return in Redis SCAN calls.

host.description: A string representing a host name, such as example.com.

password.description:
Password to use for Redis connections. If undefined, no AUTH commands are sent to Redis. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

port.description: An integer representing a port number between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

server_name.description: A string representing an SNI (server name indication) value for TLS.

ssl.description: If set to true, uses SSL to connect to Redis.

ssl_verify.description: If set to true, verifies the validity of the server SSL certificate. If setting this parameter, also configure `lua_ssl_trusted_certificate` in `kong.conf` to specify the CA (or server) certificate used by your Redis server. You may also need to configure `lua_ssl_verify_depth` accordingly.

timeout.description: An integer representing a timeout in milliseconds. Must be between 0 and 2^31-2.

username.description:
Username to use for Redis connections. If undefined, ACL authentication won't be performed. This requires Redis v6.0.0+. To be compatible with Redis v5.x.y, you can set it to `default`. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

shm_name.description: Name of shared memory zone used for Kong API gateway storage

auth_method.description: Auth Method, default to token, can be 'token' or 'kubernetes'.

auth_role.description: The role to try and assign.

host.description: A string representing a host name, such as example.com.

port.description: An integer representing a port number between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

tls_server_name.description: SNI used in request, default to host if omitted.

token.description:
Consul ACL token. 
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault). 
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

tos_accepted.description: If you are using Let's Encrypt, you must set this to `true` to agree the terms of service.

protocols.description: A set of strings representing HTTP protocols.
